intro: Ornithogalum macranthum, commonly known as the giant star-of-Bethlehem, is a striking bulbous plant native to southern Africa. It features tall, slender stems that bear clusters of large, white, star-shaped flowers, which are highly ornamental. The plant belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its blooming period typically occurs in late spring to early summer, adding a dramatic touch to the landscape.
